author: konmaorg
title: K SPROUT-Leveraging Indian Startups
description: There are various startups in India that do not have the right mentorship, a platform to leverage their ideas and raise seed funds.

f6_assessments.q0:
I strongly agree that this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
The proposal aims to engage and educate entrepreneurs and aspiring entrepreneurs about decentralization and project catalyst, providing the possibility of raising funds for their projects in a decentralized way and improving the cardano ecosystem in india.
f6_assessments.q1: I strongly agree that it is highly likely that this proposal will be implemented successfully because within the team there are people who know about education, know how to make proposals in catalyst, have mentored startups,they have efficiently answered questions from the community and are building an interesting community in India.
f6_assessments.q2:
I agree that this proposal provides me with sufficient information to assess the progress in attaining its stated goals.
I can clearly identify the problem and the solution to it, the roadmap and implementation time are clearly defined, they have a variety of social networks to communicate progress.
I still need to see the milestones in more specific terms, for example how many people or startups they intend to attend for the first, second and third cohort, how they are going to measure the effectiveness of their marketing campaign in numbers.

f6_assessments.q0: India has the 3rd largest startup ecosystem, but it doesn't have the right mentor and promotion platform. Proposing ideas to encourage the startup community in India to participate in decentralized fundraising. By organizing seminars and introductory programs. Propose a clear description and specific solution. However, it would be beneficial to have specific solutions to the risks that may arise when the project is implemented.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provides a roadmap with a detailed timetable and specific tasks to be done in the project. Recommended budget $24,900 and broken down, reasonable for different times, jobs. In addition, there are many details that demonstrate the experience and important skills required to carry out the project of the members. Power up the success of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: This is a brand new proposition and the team has laid out the plan that is clear, specific and workable. Budgets are explained transparently, easily audited. However, it would be nice to add a few specific performance metrics, increasing clarity and ease of measuring project progress and success. If successful, the proposal will benefit the development of the Indian and Cardano ecosystems.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed group has researched and learned about India's strengths. The team has relied on strength in India having the 3rd largest startup ecosystem which has more than 38,000 startups and is active today. The team encourages the startup community to participate in Decentralized Fundraising. The proposal clearly describes and has many specific, impactful solutions to the challenge. However, the team needed a more specific solution to the risk it considered.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal provides a clear, detailed plan. Specific routes are analyzed in each timeline and each task to be performed. The $24,900 budget proposal is perfectly reasonable and specifically allocated for what needs to be done in the project. The team has provided sufficient evidence to demonstrate the experience and skills required to carry out the project of its members. Show the power of success and sustainability of the project.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal team provided enough detailed information in the plan to easily measure the successful progress of the project. Budget transparency, sufficient audit information. This is a complete plan for a completely new project in my opinion. And I personally like this idea.

f6_assessments.q0: In this proposal a solution is proposed in which way money can be raised and how people's ideas can be used. It has added value in the cardano ecosystem because India already has the third largest startup ecosystem and they are going to tackle the fundraising and mentorship issues. This proposal clearly states the goals they want to achieve. This project can be expanded in the future if more funds are raised and reach more people. Personally, I would also go for the opportunity to help the local population who do not have a computer to participate in such a project.
f6_assessments.q1: This proposal clearly shows a team with associated links. The people in this team already have experience with large projects. The budget is clearly defined with the accompanying roadmap. There is a clear timetable with all the steps explained. The technical aspects could be written out in more detail in the proposal. The budget seems quite small to me to be able to pay everyone who participates in this. The risks that the makers may encounter have clearly been taken into account. It would also be useful to include a link to their website in this proposal. It would be even clearer if there was a video about how they will achieve this in reality.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal includes a clear roadmap in which the performance is stated per component. Metrics/KPIs are included to determine the success of the proposal. The proposal certainly has a future if enough campaigns and people are gathered to participate in this project. This project provides a clear solution to the problem that needs to be addressed.

f6_assessments.q0: Yes. India is developing country with lots of good startup ideas coming from small towns to big cites for various problem solution and more. The only drawback is that people have ideas but they are not sure how to execute those ideas successfully that is why lots of indian startup are failing and i think the main reason is not good mentorship and fund raising process. I think that the proposal is effectively address the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: Yes mentioned plan and roadmap seems very clear and achievable. Because of covid lots of people got to know about digital education, zoom and other tools it became their daily life part so one can easily get mentored using those tools easily. Arranging weekly workshop on social media will be good start for people to understand the basic of decentralisation , cardano and much more and by that it will definitely help community to scale and exapnd. the interactive workshop on zoom will be good idea to help people to learn and understand about fund raising, mind mapping and much more thing followed by startup festival and event so they can grow independently and learn.
f6_assessments.q2: Yes the information provided here is sufficient to audit the process and success of the proposal. they have good plan from starting weekly online session on various social media platform like twitter, instagram, facebook etc to host start up events and live working session that will bring more people also their continues feedback and monitored tools will be good to track the entire process effectively.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal fits well and addresses the challenge with the goal of supporting the growth and expansion of cardano in India by organizing recurring cardano workshops making good use of several social media channels. This for me is game changing since its in alignment with the metrics of this challenge by increasing the number of participation by Indians into catalyst through engagements and proposal submission, number of dapps actually built on the cardano ecosystem among others. This inniattive by the proposer and team is laudable and has the potential of bringing value to the entire cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal team seem to be the people of the task. I am confident that with their relevant skills and experience they possess they will be able to execute the project. 
In addition, their previous achievement of having being funded to execute a similar project gives the assurance that they are capable of executing this project should they be funded.  
The team is up to task by providing a detailed roadmap, and timelines for their engagements with audience. Budget is reasonable, well broken into smaller bits , and feasible enough in the successful execution of this project when funded.
f6_assessments.q2: •	The setting up of public meetings by the proposer and team has the potential of ensuring high auditability in the sense that it makes it easier and possible for the cardano community to be readily informed about the progress of the project during its execution process. Furthermore  the documents / reports the proposer intends to turn-in to the catalyst management team such as Weekly campaign reports, Workshop participant reports, Feedback report, Session report etc. is a great initiative and key to measure the success of their project should they be funded. I think this is a great idea by the proposer and should be emulated by all other proposers.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal certainly fits very well with the objectives of the challenge, because it intends to develop a series of activities that have the common objective of providing a mentoring service so that Indian startups can learn ways to relate to our blockchain and manage to raise initial funds for your projects. The proponent explains very richly what these activities would be, which would be quite varied. The so-called weekly Workshops on “Decentralized Fundraising” would take place, in which educational modules would be produced that are intended to circulate on various social media, such as linkedin and facebook. I found it extremely positive that the proponent informs us of the specific topics covered in each workshop session, this gives us an exact vision of what he intends to create with this program. Generally, when proposals are about promoting events, it is not explained which exact topics would be covered, which does not cause a full understanding of the process. In that case, we know exactly what would happen in each encounter. In addition to these workshops, there would be “Weekly events at the Clubhouse and Twitter Spaces” and “Interactive sessions and training modules in Zoom or Konmaverse (virtual meeting space)”, that is, the activities would not be fully face-to-face, which would allow all Indians who wished to participate in this project would have this possibility, without necessarily depending on being in the exact place where the meetings will take place. We also know what subjects would be covered in these sessions (“mind mapping, Design Thinking, How to write a proposal?, public speaking”), which generates, once again, a solid visualization of the activities that will be developed. Finally, the proponent will promote what he calls the “Startup Idea Festival”, among the startups that participate in the activities described so far. However, it is not very clear what kind of competition this would be, how they would be compared and so on. But overall, I think we have more than enough information to understand what would be done and how it would be done, and all activities are aligned with the objective of the challenge of expanding our blockchain to the inhabitants of India. With this, there will certainly be a double benefit, both for the popularization of our blockchain and for the Indian members of the startups, who would add Cardano technologies to their actions and all the benefits that this can offer.
f6_assessments.q1: The script allows us to have a very accurate view of the process, since the activities that will take place each week during the months of April and May are defined. I was surprised about the duration of this proposal, because there are so many activities I thought the time would be longer, however, the way it is presented to us, the timeline related to specific actions for each week creates a very solid understanding of the process development of this project. So in relation to the roadmap, I have no criticism to make, I can't even say that the activities could be more detailed because all the necessary detail is presented in the impact part, so when we analyze the feasibility of the project we already have in mind how everything would happen. . Now talking about the budget, the “Program Planning and Management Team” part is perfectly explained, as there is a lot of detail, we know who would receive how much and also the value of the working hours of each of the professionals involved. . However, the parts cited first should be better specified. I will explain. For example, in the marketing part, 2 thousand dollars would be allocated monthly for this. But how would this project be marketed? Which dissemination strategies would be adopted in which media would be launched? In the “Idea Showcase Festival Prizes (3 Cohorts) - $3,000 x 3 = $9,000” part, how would these prizes be distributed? How many divisions would the $3,000 value have, that is, how many monthly winners are we proposing? I would like those parts that don't talk about the salaries of those involved to be better detailed. Finally, speaking of the team, some people give more information about themselves than others. Generally speaking, we know the full names and we have the linkedin profiles of all participants. However, some inform in the proposal itself what are their professional attributions, their academic formations and some previous works. When seeing see, it would be ideal that all the participants had informed all this information, in this way we would have more leveled knowledge about all those involved. So I think the feasibility is perfect.
f6_assessments.q2: The proponent suggests that various types of reports be generated so that progress tracking is possible, such as “Weekly Campaign Reports, Workshop Participant Reports, Feedback Report” and so on. I think that if all of them were actually developed and made available to the Cardano community, the auditability of the development process would be perfect, because we would have specific feedbacks for each part of the project (which is quite multifaceted). However, it is unclear how these reports will be made available to the Cardano community. If the proponent intends to create them, surely he has already planned some platform on which he will make them available. But which one? It would be necessary for him to clarify this issue for members of the Cardano community, would he post these reports on our community's telegram and discord channels? Or in online tools, like Miro, which is mentioned in the proposal? If this doubt were resolved, I would say that the auditability of the process was perfectly thought out. Now talking about the final results, the success scenario is that “active participants from India propose in the next Project Catalyst Funds and bring quality proposals that can add value to the Cardano ecosystem of Indian startups”. But how will this be ascertained? I think that in order to analyze such broad and extensive information, it would be necessary for the proponent and his team to carry out a direct survey with those involved in the project, in order to understand how they would be putting into practice the knowledge acquired in the workshops and in the various events of this project. It would be interesting to see in practice some examples of how the statups would be adopting Cardano, as some professionals would be proposing in Catalyst and so on. All this could be researched, the information gathered and organized, and finally transmitted to the Cardano community through a synchronous meeting, after Town Hall, for example. In this way, we would have a very well-perceived and monitored success scenario. Therefore, my opinion is that the proponent was doing very well in the part of auditing the process, but unfortunately this analysis was very abstract in relation to the final results, requiring real improvements.

f6_assessments.q0:
The Leveraging Indian Startups proposal by K SPROUT is an initiative to promote the possibility of Catalyst funding to the Indian start-up community. Their plan is to host a series of events, both offline and online in order to achieve this. The vents will be a combination of promotional Twitter spaces workshops and an Ideal Festival.

Everything needed for a successful proposal is present and very clear. The proposal makes a great case for why it would be impactful for the Cardano community, presents a clear plan of action, identifies risks, and suggest a clear path to deal with them.
f6_assessments.q1:
The presented implementation plan is clear and sufficiently detailed. The plan is broken down to the week which is very helpful in visualizing the process.

The presented budget is very reasonable and is broken down in detail, giving a clear picture of how it would be assigned if the project is funded.

All the links provided by the, 7 person, team to their professional profiles on LinkedIn check out and they seem to be more than capable to deliver on the scope of the project.

There is nothing that's missing from the Leveraging Indian Startups proposal in the Feasibility section given the scope of the project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The only thing that's missing from the auditability section in order for it to have been complete is a detailed list of KPIs with measurable metrics attached to them. Even if at this stage they would have been only estimating they still would have provided the Catalyst community with at least an indication of their expectations for the impact of the project.
For example: how many start-ups are they expecting to on-board as proposers on project Catalyst?

Everything else looks very good in the auditability section, the reporting plan is solid and the definitions of success given make sense given the scope of the project.

solution: Sensitizing the Indian start-up community to Decentralized Fundraising by hosting integrated workshops and idea showcase programs.
experience: We are a previously funded team in Fund 7 from India and we hope to pave way to bringing more proposals and ideas from India. We were funded for Konma Labz which is the R&D wing of Konma which has active participation of experts from over 15 sectors who could aid new startups.
